intro: Ceropegia kerstingii, commonly known as the silver string plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, waxy leaves. The plant produces delicate, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, attracting specific pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ceropegia kerstingii is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
